comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: The 'family car' in front of the United Airlines Boeing 247 is a Stout Scarab (info thanks to JF on Wings of Peace Yahoo Group ) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stout_Scarab

comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content:
Boeing 247 NC13321 c/n 1702 United Air Lines (before conversion to 247D). 

History, from the Boeing 247 book:
Boeing Air Transport - May 13, 1933 to April 30, 1934
United Air Lines - May 1, 1934 to June 1, 1942 (Converted to 247D standard May 27, 1935)
USAAC as C-73 - June 25, 1942 to May 3, 1945
Aero Transportes (Mexico) as XA-FEO - July 1945 to ?
Aeronaves de Michoacan, SA as XA-KAJ or XA-KAI, unknown date to about 1958
Cecil Coffin, Brooklyn, NY as N5501A - January 8, 1959 to ?

Below, two photos of this plane in Vancouver, after the 247D conversion.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/batman60/8661297975/in/photolist-ecnsLe-ecnq8H/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/batman60/8661306821/in/photolist-ecnsLe-ecnq8H/]
